title: Production Services Engineer, Infrastructure Services
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly! Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Come join the Network Engineering team that is responsible for Apple’s Global Backbone and Internet Edge! We are building the fastest and most reliable network that is required for Apple’s unique needs and supporting all of it’s products and services. The Senior Network Engineer will work in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment to design and support our global Backbone and Internet Edge. The position requires deep knowledge of and experience in protocols and systems used within Content or Service Provider Networks.
description: The Senior Network Engineer will be responsible for design, testing, documentation, training and operation of new and existing network hardware, software and supporting systems that are deployed within the Global Backbone and Internet Edge. The engineer will also be responsible for capacity planning and budgeting of network hardware and systems intended to be deployed in the network. They will need to excel in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with the ability to multi-task and collaborate closely with colleagues in Operations, Engineering and Architecture. In addition, the Senior Network Engineer will work across other, cross-functional groups and have the ability and willingness to mentor others.
key_qualifications:
6 to 8 years Network Engineering or Operations experience
Experience in operating a large scale network utilizing BGP, RSVP-TE, MPLS, VPNs, ISIS and/or OSPF
Experience with documentation of Network Design and Test Plans
Experience and knowledge of BGP Routing Policies and Internet Peering
Extensive knowledge of at least one vendor Network Operating System: JUNOS, SR-OS, EOS or IOS-XR are required
Experience with one of the following programming languages is a plus: Python, Rust, Go or C
Experience and knowledge of capacity planning and budget planning
education_experience:
College degree (BA or BS) or relevant experience; technical degree preferred

Advanced Network Certifications preferred
pay_benefits:
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $148,700 and $264,300, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.
